awd_titl_txt: Mathematical Sciences: Nonvanishing of L-functions for GL(2)
awd_abstract_narration: The research concerns the following general problem.  For                  cuspidal representations of the general linear group over number                fields and arbitrary complex numbers, the principal investigator                will consider the problem of determining whether or not the L-                  function of the representation tensored with Hecke characters of                the number field of finite order evaluated at the complex number                can vanish.  Questions related to this one and applications to                  other problems in number theory will also be considered.                             The Principal Investigator is working in the general area of               the so-called Langland's program, a program which relates two                   different looking types of functions with the goal of obtaining                 deep number theoretic consequences.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
